entries.meaning: A batten laid lengthwise between two rafters as a bearing for laths laid crosswise.
Any lath laid without actual measurement between two gauged laths.
Any of a series of laths nailed to the timbers to raise the sheet lathing above their surface to afford a key for plastering.
One of many laths used in preparing one side of a partition or framed wall, when the other side has been covered in and finished.

verbs.description: counterlath (third-person singular simple present counterlaths, present participle counterlathing, simple past and past participle counterlathed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To fit or supply with a counterlath.
